intro: Thyopsis ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty thyopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red, arranged in whorls along the stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in a fine, rusty-colored pubescence. Thyopsis ferruginea is adapted to arid conditions and thrives in well-drained soils.
